frameDefinitions: A Protagonist is in the dynamic, maintained state of being alive or has exited this state.
A Wearer wears accessories, which are made of  some Material and may have a Style.
An Entity survives a situation with some Support, which tends to be far below the accustomed or standard level expected.
These are words describing situations in which a Perpetrator wrongs a Victim by taking something (Goods) from them.
A Fugitive avoids recapture by or on the authority of Authorities in relation to a Crime which the Fugitive has committed or is suspected of having committed.

This is an abstract frame for durative activities, in which the Agent enters an ongoing state of the Activity, remains in this state for some Duration of Time, and leaves this state either by finishing or by stopping.
frameExamples: She wore a black velvet <t>hat</t> on her head.
Harry <t>subsisted</t> on ramen and cheap beer through college.
Half of the team <t>held</t> <t>up</t> the tellers while the others were stationed to report the arrival of police.
He is in fact a <t>fugitive</t> of the law and you must inform the police if you see him.
listRoleDefinitions: <fen>Protagonist</fen> identifies the being or entity that is  dead or alive.
This role identifies the <fen>Figure</fen> or form being described by the target.
The time in which the <fen>Protagonist</fen> is dead or alive.
The living organism which requires the <fen>Support</fen> to survive.
The resource that the <fen>Entity</fen> relies on to survive through a situation.
The <fen>Perpetrator</fen> is the person (or other agent) that takes the <fen>Goods</fen> away by force or threats.
The <fen>Victim</fen> is the person (or other sentient being or group) that owns the <fen>Goods</fen> before they are taken away by the <fen>Perpetrator</fen>.
Source is the initial location of the goods, before they change location.
The <fen>Time</fen> indicates when the Robbery occurs.
The <fen>Place</fen> is where the Robbery occurs.
The <fen>Fugitive</fen> has escaped and/or is evading capture by law enforcement <fen>Authorities</fen>.
The <fen>Time</fen> when the <fen>Fugitive</fen> is evading law enforcement.
This role identifies the general <fen>Place</fen> where the <fen>Fugitive</fen> is located.
This role identifies the <fen>Activity</fen> in which the  <fen>Agent</fen>  is engaged.
This role identifies the <fen>Time</fen> when the <fen>Activity</fen> occurs.
This role identifies the <fen>Place</fen> where the <fen>Activity</fen> occurs.
listRoleExamples: <fex>He</fex> lived on peanuts until she came along.
Harry managed to subsist <fex>on ramen and cheap beer</fex> through college.
They ROBBED a bank in North Berkeley <fex>last May</fex>.
They robbed a bank <fex>in North Berkeley</fex>.
Only two years earlier <fex>she</fex> had been on the lam from charges of embezzlement.
He was a fugitive <fex>in the early 1990s</fex>.
Sloan, on the lam <fex>in Michigan</fex> for the last five months, is due to appear in court this Monday.

passageCandidateSpans.text: BBC Genome Blog 27 October 2016 News After Noon
